Reviews.Title: “Good, Affordable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Enosh Y
Reviews.Content: It is a great location and affordable for a double bed room. It is just 5 mins walk from the Causeway bay where you have shopping and Subway station. I recommend this Hotel if you want to stay at Hongkong side. The only thing that you will find it a bit of inconvenience is that the bathroom are transparent, No smiling faces, check in at 2PM only. So if u arrive early u have to wait till 2PM. You might wanna keep ur luggage at the lobby and go for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: rtjz84
Reviews.Content: The entrance was quite remote. I would not have seen it, if I have not seen the banner outside the entrance door. They have move the reception to level 2. The day I arrived, the wifi was down due to maintance. It was down for the next 3 days. I booked this hotel, mainly because of their free wifi. So I believe you all can imagine my disappointment. The staffs was alright. Some of them were providing the minimum or basic service. no "smile", no "extra mile"... I was give the room 203. The room was really small compare to the one I saw online. Housekeeping was good. Replacing the normal amenities was done everyday without fail. Eg: towels, toothbrush, shower gel, shampoo. However, if you ask for extra things like pillow or blanket, u will have to wait for hours, as they have to check for their availablility. We requested for 3 extra pillow, it came 2 hours later. I requested for extra blanket, it never came and have no news or it there after. I might consider to return, if the service improve and wifi fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, bad staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Eva P
Reviews.Content: It is the worst hotel I ever seen that it shows no respect to their customers. Poor staff attitudes for customers' request. It is not worthwhile at all to book this hotel, its reservation service and management are at a very low level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oleg2010
Reviews.Content: I was there in May 2010. Very clean with rather small but beautifull rooms. We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed it. Location is good - not far from subway. Actually we had most of our time out of the hotel so that we used it just for sleeping and it is that satisfied us completely.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mmcg968
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, another hotel masquerading as a boutique hotel but what is really a cheap hotel overcharging for what's on offer. The reception is on the second floor, tiny and largely taken up with luggage deposited by the guests. I arrived early but not that early at 1100am. When I asked if a room was available I was told check-in was at 2pm. I said that I knew what time the check-in was but did they have a room ready. Not negotiable. The hotel could have been empty but they weren't going to let me check in any earlier than the designated time. I supposed I should have asked the pilot of the flight to circle Hong Kong for several hours so as not to inconvenience the hotel by arriving a few hours early. So I had to dump my bags and wander the streets for several hours. I wouldn't have minded if the hotel had a decent lobby, cafe or bar but no, they have nothing of the sort so you're turfed out and onto the streets. The rooms were tiny. Bad enough if you were on your own but with two people it was like a permanent game of Twister. The bathroom is one of those perspex boxes with a semi opaque strip halfway up. It doesn't leave anything to the imagination so you had better be very familiar with the person you're staying with when it comes to performing your ablutions. TV reception was rubbish. It was like watching a ticker tape parade in a snow storm and it was almost exclusively sport. Lastly, why call a hotel the WiFi and then the wi-fi doesn't work? Maybe they should call themselves the Here's-An-Ethernet-Cable-Cos-We-Can't-Fix-The-Wi-Fi Hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in HK I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Pavel P
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know it's a 4 star and it's not really luxury. But after staying in several 5-star hotels in HK I must admit this one is the best. Central location, close to any transport (whether subway or trams), neat clean rooms and THE FASTEST internet. Trust me it's a problem in China. And also VERY cool balcony/terrace on the 4th floor with a street view, just ideal for a relaxed cup of beer:) They take an advance fee upon checking in. Then they return it back.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Joshua D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my girlfriend. HK was the final leg of our 6 week trip around South East Asia. This was undoubtedly one of our favourite hotels. We booked thru Agoda and got a reasonable rate. The rooms were very nice and clean. Sleek and modern with a nice flat screen TV and great shower. Also a great view from our room on the 21st floor. Air conditioning worked great. Hotel location was AMAZING. 5 minute walk from Causeway Bay MTR. It was so easy to get around everywhere! And if you need a taxi, you can grab one anywhere on Lockhart Road. Another major plus was the free Wifi. It worked very well at all times! And a complimentary desktop PC in the reception area as well. The staff were not particularly amazing, but they were nice enough. Simply put, I feel like we got what we paid for. And maybe a bit more. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Call it Hostel not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baul_37
Reviews.Content: Beaware if you have reached early in the morning--There is no way of early check in. Its 2.00 but no alternative. There is not even a chair to sit, No lobby, No restaurant. Even after 2.00 you have to wait until front desk staff hand over the room key. In room amenities are fine. Rooms are clean but very small. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, does what it says on the tin ...”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_Stef
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a great location for transport and shops. Very traditional looking HK main street. Hotel is easily missed and as most things in HK is build vertically. Rooms are decently sized with all fundamentals present. Wifi is good speed, as you would expect. Staff was friendly and helpful. Not a luxury place, but decent clean and well located. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique in a great location”
Reviews.Author: davinagifford
Reviews.Content: The one word missing from the name on here is Boutique, which should give you an idea of the size of this hotel! The doorway is tiny, and there's about 3 rooms per floor, but it's new, clean, and exactly what we like. We had a triple room on the second floor which was perfectly sized - a double bed, a single, a small table, bathroom, benches etc. Nothing extraneous, but it's not the kind of place where you stay to spend time in the rooms. The room was dark, which was both good and bad - it meant you could sleep easily, but it also led to oversleeping some mornings! The airconditioning was incredibly incredibly loud, but the windows didn't open, so without Aircon the rooms were very stuffy. The bathroom in our room was of black glass, but one of our friends stayed in a family room and the bathroom was clear glass! not much privacy there, so might be worth checking that before going. The wifi was fast - this is the main reason we stayed here. Location was great - short walk from Causeway Bay MTR and the shopping district. Short walk to the Wan Chai ferry to Kowloon. We caught a taxi from the airport direct to the hotel, but the size and relative newness meant the driver had some trouble locating it. The Causeway Bay MTR is not far, so would be easy to airport express and then change onto the MTR. Overall we had a great time, the room was exactly what we expected, we had wifi, and we were situated in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Joke! Rooms look nice in the photo's but Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Henry C
Reviews.Content: First impression was Wow! How Small is this place! Entrance to lobby is big as a Door way 2 meters wide and no one is at reception to greet you. Has 2 lift in total. Reception is located on the 2nd level and very small. Prepare to wait in a tight space when busy! - We stayed in room # 1702 Superior Double: (more like single ) - They gave us only 1 door entry card. - Lift was small and took long. - Our room was small and not much room to move around. ( really was built for 1 small person ). - No where to leave our 2 average size suitcase. - No where for my partner to do her make up as the mirror was behind the clothe hangers. Had no light. - We had very soft pillows so we ask for an extra 2 but they only gave 1 and said they don't have enough? - The safe was not fixed to the cupboard and could be easily be carried away. - All our towels had a few old stains on them and could feel the bleach on them when we used them. - TV had very limited channels, bad reception and especially discovery channel was very fuzzy. - The Air con was noisy and blowing dust everywhere. We told them about this problem and they sent someone to replace the filters but same thing happened. There was dust on bed sheets, table, TV, bath room and made us sick with a dry throat when we woke up every morning. -The fan in the bath room was on and spinning so loud that is was annoying. Even hard to fall asleep. - We also had to pay in full up front so they was no refunds so there was no choice but to stay. The booking was made for 6 nights but after 1 night we wanted out. - For all meals we had to walk around the block. This is mainly a bathroom/fittings/ tiles show room street. - Red light district, so not really recommended to families. Won't even recommend this for place for young couples. Good thing about this hotel is the FREE Wifi. The location is Great! The Food and Shops on Hennessy Rd is near by. Trams and MTR 5-10mins away. Sogo Shopping and Time Square near by. Last note: Will Never stay here AGAIN even if the rooms where $50/night!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent till we check out”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: I was attending an exhibition in Hong Kong and need to locate a hotel near the exhibition hall. After booking and found the hotel which is very close to our venue. Once you exit from airport, just make your way to MRT and follows the instruction on their web site how to come to this hotel. No F&B outlet but a lot of food nearby the hotel. Excellent WIFI speed. I booked a 3 person room and room is small but enough to accommodate 1 large bag and 3 medium size bags. The bed is so comfy and we slept like a baby. Another thing needs mentioning, they have friendly and helpful staff. Excellent hotels and we will come back again for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A value hotel at Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: JaneJ2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wifi Boutique Hotel for two nights during the March 2012. This hotel is at center location of Hong Kong Island. Most of attractions and shopping area can be easily reached by foot. My room number is 1702, the room size is good knowing this is in Hong Kong. This room has a double bed and its firm and clean. Bathroom is divided by glass wall and equipped with basic necessaries including shampoo and shower liquid (see my photos). Towels are clean. Housekeeping did good job. Other Amenities in this room are: slippers, high-speed wireless broadband internet access, 32-inches wall mounted LCD TV, DVD player, iPod docking with radio alarm, hairdryer, safety box, refrigerator, electric kettle, tea bags and free bottle of water daily. This hotel does not have restaurant, and you certainly no need to worry for food, there are so many food choices around the hotel including few convenient stores.. The only issue I had is the noise at night, there was constant background noise and I could not figure out the coming source since I did not turn on the air conditioning. My guess is the noise might come from the public transportations running on the street below. The sound is amplified through these narrowly sit high rise buildings at night. Tip for arriving from Hong Kong International Airport, from arriving hall, looking for Airport Express Line (机场快线) sign，buy a ticket to Hong Kong Station, which is the final stop (actually there are only three stops). You can buy single journey (100 HKD) or round trip ticket (180 HKD) which is good for 30 days. Traveling time from the airport to Hong Kong Station is about 20-25 minutes. Then change to the Hong Kong Line (dark blue line) towards the Chai Wan (柴湾) direction and there are 2 choices for going to Wifi Boutique Hotel: 1. get off at Wan Chai Station (湾仔), take Exit A1, left turn onto Hennessey Rd (轩尼诗道)，walking about 8 minutes until hit the Marsh Rd, then turn left, walking about 2 minutes, turn left again on Lockhart Rd , looking for number 366, which only few steps away. 2. or get off at Causeway Bay Station (铜锣湾), take Exit C, turn left and walk on Lockhart Rd for about 7 minutes, the hotel will be on the left at #366. Personally I went to hotel by the choice 2, and went to the airport by choice 1. I think the choice 1 is easier since Hennessey Rd is the big road and Lockhart Rd is smaller. However, the hotel staff said choice 2 is shorter than choice 1. See my photos

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to brag about...”
Reviews.Author: spotmenow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a transit. The room is on a smaller size. I don't mind it but the bed, is shorter than the usual size! For a 6 foot tall person, my feet are hanging out of the bed and it was so uncomfortable. To top it off, the pillows are so high and hard. when we asked for different pillows they simply said they don't have any other that are available. The next morning we got stiffed necks because of the pillow. The room design is so horrible, they don't even have a large enough space for a suitcase to open. Each time we wanted to get something from the suitcase, we had to bring the suitcase to the bed. Forget about the floor size ! No closet for coats. There are hangers but they hang right above the suitcase space. So the space between your suitcase and the hanger won't be enough to hang a regular adult size jacket. They should have instead put some hooks by the door!! The air conditioner can't be controlled. It won't go up or down. We were in room 1002. Find somewhere else to stay than this hotel when in Hong Kong!.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it promises to do..but no more than that”
Reviews.Author: aloisw8
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel ear;y in the morning in the hope of an early check in, but as the hotel was full we had to wait the full 6 hours until 14.00...and not a minute before. They did keep our bags but there was nowhere to sit so it was straight out and about...thank goodness it was not raining and we had slept well on the flight over. At 14.00 precisely we were given our room card. Nice enough compact room, flat screen TV, free wifi, iPod doc, fridge, kettle, ...kitchen sink, no microwave fitted...just a gap where it may have once been, shower room...glass door {opaque)...but main asset is the location near everything in Wanchai and Causeway bay...so it did what it promised to do at a reasonable price...just don't arrive earlier than your allotted check in time!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: sablefilms
Reviews.Content: They have booked airport shuttle bus services for me but the driver didn't pick me up at the appointed time at Novotel closeby. The shuttle company wanted me to take a taxi to Empire Hotel minutes away. Again they left me before I arrived.I returned to Novotel for another scheduled stop. With all these failings,. Wifi never intervened to help me with the bus company. Instead they transferred me to voice mails. Novotel concierge helped me to get a deal on a taxi cab to go to the airport in time for my flight. And at no time they offered for my cab fares or refund nor apology.

Reviews.Title: “Modern compact triple room with free wifi but far location from mtr”
Reviews.Author: starnite000
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room. It comes in a queen bed and 2 twins bed. The toilet and funiture looks pretty modern. However, the space available for putting luggages is limited. There is also not enough space to hang out wet bath towels. There are 3 complimentary mineral water daily in the mini fridge. The water from shower tap will suddenly turn very hot after every10min, and it will resume back to the ideal temperature after few seconds, so be careful when you shower for more than 10 min. The location of the hotel is not very ideal, very far from mtr. It is equally far from tong luo wan and wan chai mtr. We felt like we were starting and ending our days on a bad note (need to walk very far to take mtr). We were only given 1 card to share among 3 people and we were rejected when we requested for another card, due to the lack of cards available. The airport shuttle bus is a bad idea. It took abt 2 hrs to reach the hotel (including a slight jam during the journey). it was the last stop among all the stops it made. The best thing about the hotel is the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel unless your plans are set in stone”
Reviews.Author: M4Chap
Reviews.Content: They have NO cancellation policy and charge 100% of your reservation charge even if you give 4 weeks notice (which I did) Doesn't matter whetrher you turn up or not, full charge applies. Vicious or what ? Tiny entrance and tiny reception with no signage outside. Calls itself a boutique hotel, which means flashing lights in the elevator/lift and no cupboard to hide your clothes. Don't trust the airport shuttle timetable, you need to give more than 2 hours notice, but they don't tell you that. No intructions for any equipment in the room e.g. safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: G3VVW
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very fresh the room was rather dark due to the walls floor etc everything was black. Walking distance to downtown, very good staff..

Reviews.Title: “It lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: Manila_trvl
Reviews.Content: 1. the Internet was fast, reliable and strong and FREE. it's important for me to have free Internet as I use it heavily to plan my itinerary for the next day. 2. Location was excellent! it's a few mins away from times square, world trade center and the causeway MTR. and most attractions I saw were at hong kong island.... the peak, Stanley market, Central. 3. Staff was courteous and helpful. 4. Rooms were a bit small but we only slept in them so it was ok. 5. Toilets were CLEAN! and looked new. that was important. towels were fresh and they had the basic amenities. 6. The beds were a bit stiff but when your dead tired walking, it doesn't matter. the sheets were soft and clean anyway 7. the electricity of the whole room shuts off if there is no key. so the drinks in the ref don't stay cold. 8. there's a really good bakery a few steps away that sells cheap and fresh bread. inside is a chinese restaurant that has good authentic Cantonese food. you just have to ask for an English menu. it's mostly locals who eat inside. overall, i don't mind staying in this hotel again, as long as they maintain the price. it's value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights last month. I was in Hong Kong for business but chose to move hotels (to something cheaper) and stay two more nights at my own expense. Thus, I appreciated the good value this hotel offered for such a central location--between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR stops. It was easy to find taxis by the hotel, and I could also reach lots of things by walking, bus, or tram, as well. The rooms were a good size--in fact, on the spacious side--and the promised wi-fi was available. I did find the bathrooms to be badly in need of airing out. The doors closed automatically, so there was no way to keep air flowing into the bathroom and it got stuffy. The rooms were very clean, which was nice. The lobby was small, and the staff was not very helpful--I found the large deposit demanded from us pretty absurd, but it doesn't appear to have ended up on my credit card in the end. Overall, there was nothing especially good about this hotel except for its price and location--but that is worth a lot in Hong Kong. Not a bad find.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erminhaj
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is just excellent. Its between busy Wanchai and Causewaybay MTR stations. Plenty of other transportation options including Trams, buses, Ferry and Cab to go anywhere in Hong Kong. As per Hong Kong standard, the room size very reasonable. The furniture and fixtures are good quality and a good utilization of space. The staff was very friendly and good English speaker. The only minor problem I found was absence of closet and security safe in the room,

Reviews.Title: “boutique!”
Reviews.Author: clownfishUk
Reviews.Content: Boutique as we know usually means 'pokey', cant recommend this hotel. The rooms are cupboards and it is only acceptable at about $75 us per night. The air con cannot be left on so the room is always hot on return, the lift is very slow and the overall impression in the room is claustrophobic. There are better places for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MYTong
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews at TripAdvisor, i got to know and stayed at Wifi Hotel for 6 nights in Sept 11, which cost me less than S$800. The hotel is located in between Wan Chai and Causeway MTR but nearer to Causeway Bay MTR (5-10 min walk ).And there are alot of food choices along the way to Causeway Bay MTR.The trams and buses are also convienent choices for visiting the Hong Kong Island. Hotel room was quite big for the price paid and clean. However, the beds were a little hard and the bath towels sightly stained. Overall, its convienent, clean and affordable. I'll certainly choose this hotel again for my next shopping trip in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “No Complains”
Reviews.Author: PeterLim_Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stay there during May 2011. Thou its located at Wanchai, the nearest MTR station is causewaybay. Do not alight at WanChai unless u wanna walk longer. Stayed on the 22nd floor. Room size is all right for the price. TV, wifi, iphone dock were provided.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, clean, value for money central hotel with FREE wifi!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDonald
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend as a centrally situated very reasonably priced hotel in Hong Kong and it ticks all the boxes. It's a no frills place, small rooms (like everywhere in Hong Kong) but full size double beds, neat rooms (modern decor) and nice ensuite glass shower rooms. Free wifi/DVD/TV in all rooms. This hotel has no breakfast or lounge facilities but it is surrounded by places to go to suit every taste. I went to Starbucks for breakfast every morning - croque monsieur, wheat toast and jam and cinnamon pastry, pretty cheap. The hotel is also a short walk from Sogo Pacific, the huge Japanese department store. The hotel is uber clean and reception staff welcoming. I arrived at 10am way before check-in time, but got a room immediately, which was hugely appreciated. The hotel is close to several MTR stations (underground) and taxis are cheap and easy to get on the street. The hotel also participates in a shuttle bus service to and from the airport, which you need to book with them in advance. I took the high speed train (buy a ticket at the airport) and it's five mins to the hotel in a cab (although none of the taxi drivers ever knew where it was, it has an entrance that is easy to miss you have to give them the full address). I had one problem in the hotel - the room door would not lock, and it was fixed immediately. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to cut costs and be central but it won't suit people who like having on site breakfast, bars, etc. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: hauyoung
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 long blocks 10 minutes walking distance from the MTR station, If you have a lot luggage then it might be tough. Hotel is pretty small, there are only 3 rooms on each floor. I stayed in room x01 for the first night then switched to x02 because of a small leak in x01. x01 is a bigger room, you will have some extra room to put your luggage, they also fits 2 single beds. x02 is smaller. Their rooms are pretty new and clean. There are a lot shops and restaurants near the MTR. Their bathrooms are totally clear in x02 rooms, so beware if you are staying in the double bed room with someone other than your other half.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of cancellation policy.”
Reviews.Author: PeteM1A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel. It is an "ok" hotel, I would stay there again. However beware of their cancellation policy, it is draconian. I booked on Monday afternoon to stay Friday night. On Tuesday night I canceled as my plans changed. +48 hours’ notice of a cancellation but they insist on taking full payment on the cancellation. I think this is a con as most hotels give 12-24 hour cancellation times. I ran them but they insisted on payment. I stopped my card and they lost a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Subway, Cheap for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Livi B
Reviews.Content: The room was relatively small, but that's to be expected for Hong Kong. It was clean but a little dusty due to some construction. We stayed here for New Years and it was very convenient being in the Wan Chai area. The hotel is located a few blocks from the subway and close to small food shops and a larger shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “love the design”
Reviews.Author: GoodDealsNTravel
Reviews.Content: After our run down and dirty stay at Largos Hotel, we were happy with the last part of our trip at Wifi Hotel. Likes: Room - Sleek and modern. Loved the design. Good size. Glass bathroom walls. Rain shower heads. Queen size bed. Flat screen television. Sports, English and Chinese channels. iPod docking. Mini refrigerator. Drawer for your clothes. Wifi access was at a good speed. Location - Close to Wan Chi, Causeway Bay and Central. Close to many restaurants. Close to cable car. MTR is about 5-10 min walk. I recommend taking the "ding ding" cable cars if you are not in a hurry. It's a great way to see the city. Dislikes: Room - The bed was hard as a rock. I could hear my neighbors coming and going from their room (there are only 3 rooms on each floor). Considering that I was on the 14th floor, I could still hear traffic sounds. It was okay during the night, but it was quite loud in the morning and afternoon (I like to sleep in). I found a couple of stains on the towels. Housekeeping was okay, but I have a feeling the rooms will start looking a bit run down in a year or so. Lobby - Looks like the hotel is still in the process of remodeling. They have two elevators. One for guest and one for construction. We always ended up getting the elevator for construction, which was always taped up in plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even stay their cancelled it 1 month prior and they still charged us for four nights.”
Reviews.Author: raechris
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my disgust that we booked to stay at this hotel in September and was unable to go. We then emailed them twice to cancel it as I like to make sure that everything was done properly. The emails were received as they did not return to us. I gave them a months notice of cancellation as well. This hotel put the four nights that we had cancelled on our credit card amounting to over $800 New Zealand dollars and to this day they have not taken the amount off. Please be aware of this when you are making a booking with this Hotel. Check your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Worth A Try”
Reviews.Author: mintymalone
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Free wifi which is convenient for any traveler THE BAD: Room was so small that it was impossible to fully open two pieces of luggage at the same time. The room also wasn’t as clean as I would have liked it to be. Funky smell in the bathroom didn’t help. I also sensed that we had guests of the spooky kind. This is coming from a person who rarely feels anything. I could have been imagining things though so take this info with a grain of salt. THE UGLY: Location, location, location! The 10 minute walk to and from Causeway Bay was difficult! Especially hard to do when feet are tired and there are loads of bags to carry. I had to motivate myself every night just to make it back to the hotel. I could have dealt with a small, funky, haunted room but being relatively far from Causeway Bay was a deal breaker for me. Don’t get me wrong though as Wifi Hotel is still worth a try if shopping isn’t the main reason why one is in Hong Kong. Just make sure that rates are reasonable and cheaper than what other 3 star hotels in nearby locations offer. For pictrues go to: http://dumtodee.blogspot.com/2010/12/wifi-hotel-is-worth-try.html

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nzchinagirl
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on our room at Wifi Hotel. The location of the hotel is great, it is near WanChai subway, think it took us about 8-10 minutes to walk there. The checkout was a bit slow, but otherwise the service there was fine. The room was really nice and clean, it was modern and very comfortable. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms with dirty floors & towels”
Reviews.Author: LaSunny
Reviews.Content: During our stay, wifi hotel was full of visitors from mainland China who seemed to ignore the 'non smoking' rules and who were quite noisy at all hours (including at night). Floors were not cleaned during our stay, some towels were stained/dirty and there were a lot of hairs everywhere. Rooms (very tiny) have relatively good tv's and other cool stuff, but the most basic (and important) stuff is very cheap and of bad quality. Location - great Customer service - very poor, indifference to customers' needs, some young staff members were unpleasant Renovations - which cause the lifts to delay and dust Internet - good, included in price Tv- nice tv's but very limited English channels Overall - bad sleep quality and bad customer service will not bring us back... there are much better hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “From Causewaybay MTR, take exit C to Lock...”
Reviews.Author: Gingering
Reviews.Content: From Causewaybay MTR, take exit C to Lock hart road or Sino plaza, walk for 3 min passing 2 crossroads, u will find the hotel on the left. It s so easy to be skipped because the front gate is small and the sign name is placed on the side. The location is generally good, near Sogo, Times square, lee garden...if u re a shopper. HK convention center is at Wanchai, 1 more MTR station. Airport express station and the ferry station is at MRT Hongkong- 2 more stations away only. The room wall is quite thin but it is spacious enough takng into account Hong kong room space standard. I really like free wifi service here and there is 1 radio/ speaker for ipod/ iphone deck. TV is big and new compared to the 4 star i just stay in recently (Habour plaza Metropolis). In general, it s good and stay there since it is still new and hasnt worn out yet :)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel?... Not at all!...! Better to stay away!”
Reviews.Author: ElinorinUK
Reviews.Content: Wifi, which seems to be geared towards Chinese visitors, is a relatively new hotel (still under renovations) which lacks in the housekeeping and customer service departments and is definitely NOT a boutique hotel and neither value for money - you can easily get a MUCH better hotel for the price (In fact, it will be extremely hard to get something worse...)! Wifi has a good location, free internet and good TVs (with very few English channels, though) - however, this is where the benefits end...: the tiny new rooms are already dirty (look under the beds!!!....), customer service is poor, rooms can be noisy at night, and one needs to be very cautious with the credit card handling and deposits in this hotel. During our stay, there were only another two westerners staying at the hotel - all the other guests were Asian, mainly Chinese from the mainland it seems. The other two westerners were very unhappy with the hotel due to dodgy practices they witnessed or heard about, the attitude of the staff, the lack of cleanliness and the noise. One of them has actually witnessed how the reception staff was trying to charge another visitor $50 (yes, fifty dollars...) for a basic drinking glass she has accidently broken... seeing the cheap glasses in our own room, we were amazed that the hotel would want to charge anything for these (a much lower quality than ones we saw broken at a couple of other hotels' restaurants, without anyone trying to charge anything for them...). The rooms are extremely tiny which makes it very hard to move, so, if you are staying here, be very cautious as this may happen to you too. We also heard of the hotel trying to hold some money from another visitor's deposit for some damaged towels or something similar. Now, the towels we were given were worn and quite damaged (one of them had a big hole in the middle!) - so this was very surprising to hear, too. Our credit card was also not handled appropriately - the whole process seemed a little dodgy. We were actually very concerned. Some of the staff members are also extremely young and seem to be totally clueless. Cleanliness (or lack of it...): During our stay, we noticed that the floors were not cleaned - there was some dirt in few areas which remined there for a few days until I actually cleaned these myself. Additionaly, my partner bent to pick up a pen from the floor on the first day and was shocked to discover what's underneath the bed... I felt totally disgusted when I looked - the floor was totally filthy! Seems like housekeeping just can't be bothered to clean there - despite the floors being extremely easy to clean. Another visitor had a dead cockroach under his bed...! Noise: There were many chinese visitors staying at the hotel and every single night we could hear arguments next door. There are 3 rooms to a floor, all of which are facing the lifts, so you can easily hear the lifts and the movement around them, too. The other two westeners had noisy floors, too - one of them had drunk men partying till the early morning hours with loud tv. The hotel claims to have sound proof rooms, however you may not hear much of the road but you will hear your neighbours very well! BTW, we also spoke with a lovely Chinese guest who did not like the type of guests at this hotel - she said that, despite being Chinese herself, she finds that a lot of the Chinese guests there are the midbehaved, noisy type. She was complaining of some noisy people on her floor, too, and also of smoking. Some floors are still being renovated and during our stay we often encountered dust inside the lifts. Wifi charges the same price like many other mid-range hotels in HK and Kowloon - but you will find that those other hotels are world apart from wifi... Wifi only has the tv's and the location but nothing else. Don't waste your money (and who knows, you may be one of those they try to charge for all kinds of 'incidentials', too - in which case, you visit may end up even more expensive!). We wouldn't recommend this hotel at all, unless you come to HK to get drunk, party hard, and could not care about cleanliness....

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a week stay while at...”
Reviews.Author: N15Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Great place for a week stay while at convention centre. Clean, new, comfortable, quiet (on 18th floor). No services other than cleaning while I was there but good space for making drinks and snacks. Great value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl031
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wifi Hotel in a deluxe room (definitely recommend upgrading). The room fixtures were all brand new, but it was definitely tiny! The hotel location is good -- it's about a 10 minute walk to either Causeway Bay or Wanchai MRT. The area around the hotel is filled with home fixture shops (tiles, bathtubs, etc), so it's interesting during the day. I definitely recommend walking down Lockhart Road to Wanchai -- many great restaurants and bars (The Dog House is great!). The hotel was going through construction on the lower 11 floors, so it's best to ensure that you're up high. Overall - I'd recommend this hotel if you're the type of person that won't spend a lot of time inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cozy but Clean”
Reviews.Author: VRUM
Reviews.Content: There are only 3 rooms on each floor which makes it very private and quite. The hotel is either new or been renovated thoroughly. Our room was very small by north American standards but saved its purpose for us. The location is great and in the heart of Wan Chai (Hong Kong Entertainment District). Also it has free WiFi internet which is not common in Hong Kong. I really recommend this hotel to young people who want to have fun....
